node.title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions

node.title: What’s Emerging From the Melting Ice?

node.title: How Esperanza Spalding and Wayne Shorter Realized His Dream: an Opera
node.description: “Iphigenia,” an update of the ancient Greek myth eight years in the making and decades in the dreaming, will begin a run of performances this month.

node.title: NASA's SpaceX Crew-3 Launch Date Changed Again After Astronaut's 'Medical Issue'
node.description: The mission marks the first ever spaceflight for three of the crew members who will be onboard the ISS-bound Crew Dragon spacecraft.

node.title: More same-sex couples may be eligible for Social Security survivor benefits.
node.description: Even after winning the right to marry across the U.S. more than six years ago, some same-sex couples have faced challenges accessing certain benefits.

node.title: New blood test can spot more than 50 types of cancer
node.description: Many of them are hard to detect early. One doctor calls the test "a game changer."

node.title: Yahoo to exit China, citing commitment to "open" internet

node.title: Huma Abedin on overcoming her husband Anthony Weiner's betrayals
node.description: In her first TV interview, the longtime aide to Hillary Clinton talks about weathering public scandal as the wife of disgraced former Congressman Anthony Weiner, and opens up about how her anger over his sexting transgressions "almost killed me."

node.title: GOP looks for upset in New Jersey governor's race as Democrats hope to buck history
node.description: The Garden State has been reliably blue in presidential and U.S. Senate elections, but an incumbent Democrat hasn't been reelected since 1977.

node.title: New York’s 5 ballot measures include proposals to make voting easier.
node.description: The ballot proposals also involve changes to civil courts, legislative redistricting and environmental rights.

node.title: Dog's Hilarious Reaction to Owner Being 'Attacked' by Vacuum Cleaner Viewed 53M Times
node.description: The dog's unfazed response led TikTok users to wonder what might have been going through its mind.

node.title: Video of Virginia Man Unsure About Critical Race Theory Watched 3.5M Times

node.title: Election Day 2021: Virginia race in spotlight as voters across U.S. head to polls
node.description: Voters in Virginia and New Jersey will be choosing governors, and there are closely-watched contests in New York City, Buffalo and Minneapolis.

node.title: Innovative program helps kids overcome their fear of needles
node.description: An estimated 63% of children are afraid of needles but technology is helping families reduce fear and anxiety.

node.title: What's behind the push for a fourth stimulus check

node.title: Ecuador says it will extend protections around the Galápagos Islands.

node.title: The ‘Jaws’ Shoot Was a Drama. Now It’s a Play.

node.title: Internet Backs Man Evicting His Girlfriend After She Kicked His Cat Out

node.title: Alien Life Could Be Found on Mars Thanks to NASA Curiosity Rover's New Trick

node.title: Wall Street not sold on Mark Zuckerberg's metaverse push
node.description: Facebook's plan to build a new digital world could prove either a bold step into the future or a massive financial folly.

node.title: Military Hospital in Afghan Capital Targeted in Attack, Taliban Say

node.title: Reduce fossil fuels in the long term but pump more now, Biden says, angering activists.

node.description: The Fox News host suggested the influence of the president and vice president could wane if Terry McAuliffe loses to Glenn Youngkin.

node.title: Difference Between iPhone 13, 12 As Apple Co-Founder Steve Wozniak Says He Can't Tell
node.description: Apple's recently released iPhone 13 models are subtly different to the iPhone 12 from 2020.

node.title: Joe Biden 'Asleep' at Climate Summit Sparks Wave of Criticism and Sympathy

node.title: He Ran the First N.Y.C. Marathon. Next Week, He’ll Run the 50th.

node.title: New figures reveal almost 400 healthcare workers across SA are refusing to be vaccinated against COVID-19
node.description: Almost 400 South Australian health sector workers have been forced to take leave after refusing to be vaccinated against COVID-19, according to figures released by SA Health.

node.title: Tentative win for drug makers in Calif. governments' opioids suit

node.description: Britain offers a warning of what happens when a country ignores Covid.

node.title: Jim Jones Warned Leo Ryan's Visit Would be a 'Grave Mistake'

node.title: Beds and medical services cut as Queensland hospital workers defy COVID-19 vaccination mandate
node.description: Of the state's 108,000 Hospital and Health Services workers, 3,830 — or 3.54 per cent — have provided no evidence of a COVID-19 vaccination and are not on leave, forcing cuts to surgical, medical and mental health beds, Queensland Health data obtained by the ABC shows.

node.title: Dozens feared trapped after deadly collapse of high-rise in Nigeria

node.title: How to Keep a Journal

node.title: The Manhattan ‘Madam’ Who Hobnobbed With the City’s Elite

node.title: The Secret 53-Year-Old British Case That Could Have Legalized Trans Identity
node.description: “The Hidden Case of Ewan Forbes,” by Zoë Playdon, investigates a long-suppressed legal case involving an aristocratic Scotsman, who, raised, at least initially, as a girl, went to court to prove his male gender.

node.title: Lincoln Broke Our Constitution. Then He Remade It.

node.title: Can Specific Foods or Diets Boost Your Testosterone Levels?

node.title: Corporate Climate Pledges Often Ignore a Key Component: Supply Chains

node.title: As U.S. Reopening Approaches, Travelers Take Their Marks

node.title: How will Macron's 'liar' claim play out with Morrison's voters?
node.description: Scott Morrison's spat with the French President is bad for his international reputation. But on the home front, the PM will reckon on neutralising Emmanuel Macron's allegation,  writes Michelle Grattan.

node.title: Search underway after fisherman falls out of tinnie into Queensland dam
node.description: Specialist divers have been dispatched to help look for the man, who fell out of his boat earlier today.

node.title: Cryptocurrency inspired by ‘Squid Game’ crashes. The industry has questions.

node.title: Unexplained gas funding timeline a 'very dark day for the Commonwealth', Federal Court judge says
node.description: Lawyers for environmental advocates question whether the federal government fast-tracked an agreement to provide funding to a gas company in a bid to hinder legal action challenging the grant.

node.title: Elon Musk says he'll donate billions to fight world hunger, but only if a UN agency meets his conditions
node.description: Elon Musk, the world's richest person, says he will donate $US6 billion to the UN's initiative to address world hunger if the global body can meet his terms around transparency and accounting.

node.title: 'New number one strategic risk is Covid endemic' - Southern DHB
node.description: The worst case scenario modelling for Southern DHB painted a grim picture for a health system already under pressure.

node.description: Police are using a drone and the Eagle helicopter to search for two men who went gone missing after fishing near Raglan on Sunday.

node.title: Auckland stays in level 3 step 1, parts of Waikato move to level 3 step 2
node.description: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern says Cabinet has decided in principle to move Auckland to alert level 3 step 2 next Tuesday at 11.59pm.

node.title: COP26 summit: Leaders strike deal to end deforestation by 2030

node.title: As Earth Warms, Human History Is Melting Away

node.description: Because so many jobs depend on automaking, the industry’s production problems are causing the pain to ripple.

node.description: An Auckland pharmacist has been found guilty of professional misconduct for the incorrect dispensing of drugs.

node.title: Trump Told Georgia Secretary of State He Believed States Would Be 'Flipping' to Him After Election

node.title: Data, other intangible assets to drive company growth - research
node.description: Intangible asset specialist EverEdge says such assets can grow much faster, which is good news for companies with business models built around data.

node.title: 'We won't enforce discrimination' - Gym owners shut shop over vaccine mandates
node.description: A West Coast couple have chosen to close their gym, instead of turning away customers who are not vaccinated.

node.title: Stephen Colbert: Biden Got the Pope’s Blessing
node.description: “The pope telling you you’re a good Catholic is like a bear telling you you’re good at pooping in the woods,” Colbert said of President Biden, who visited the Vatican over the weekend.

node.title: PM makes each-way bet on climate change at COP26
node.description: While Australians put their money on horses today, Scott Morrison had a wager of his own: An each-way bet that $20 billion in technological investments will either fix the climate crisis, or at least convince other nations Australia is doing enough.

node.title: Little risk of contamination after fire at sewage treatment plant - council
node.description: Christchurch City Council is reassuring residents there is little risk of beaches becoming contaminated with untreated waste.
